availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Franklin Clay (Henderson County, Kentucky, attorney.)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, attorney. Henderson County, Kentucky native. Son of James Williams Clay and Clarissa Ann Berry. Married to Elizabeth Eaves in Henderson, Kentucky in 1866. Graduated from Georgetown College in Kentucky in June 1860. Attorney in Henderson County, Kentucky in 1860. Admitted to the bar in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Find A Grave, "James Franklin Clay (1840-1921)," Memorial #7092252, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7092252 (accessed January 20, 2020).
E. Polk Johnson, The History of Kentucky and Kentuckians...Vol II (New York: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), 722-723.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson, Division 1, p.17.
